channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: 2 lights out on Goodwins court, 17th August
item.description:
There are 2 lights out on Goodwins court (again). This alleyway is plagued by homeless people and drug users and is hideously dangerous, filthy and neglected at the best of times. Fix this immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, New Row, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stop line faded on A,B phase - required repainting Pedestrian studs faded H phase P1,P2 - required repainting, 17th August
item.description:
Stop line faded on A,B phase - required repainting Pedestrian studs faded H phase P1,P2 - required repainting
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fox Threat in Area – Urgent Help Needed, 17th August
item.description:
A fox has been in our area for a long time. It chases adults and children and isn’t afraid of people. My kids are too scared to play outside. Neighbours are also worried. Please act quickly to remove the fox and keep us safe.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Common, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds, 17th August
item.description:
I live in hithergreen and our roads and pavements look horrible as there are so many weeds along pavements and curbs I clear my front garden and outside our house but it really looks horrible all up and down the local roads Road sweepers used to clear a lot but nothings been done in our area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Mount Pleasant Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uninsured van hasn’t moved!, 17th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Denham Street, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Fly tipping clean it please., 16th August
item.description:
Fly tipping from today. They have first gone to the corner of missenden and now they dumped the things here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Full Recycling Containers, 16th August
item.description:
Next to Tenpin Bowling and Pure Nightclub, Albion Road, Bexleyheath: Yet again, the public blue cardboard recycling containers are full and overflowing. Please could they be emptied and emptied by your contractor on a more regular basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A van came and put all this rubbish here, 16th August
item.description:
At11:25-11:32 a van came and dropped all this rubbish here. The same people as last reported. Once again please put a camera here. We cannot live like this with the noise and rubbish here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villa Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Litter Bins, 16th August
item.description:
Market Place, Bexleyheath, opposite the Furze Wren Pub at the Bus Stops: On Saturday 16th August, your street cleaning contractor Countrystyle did not empty all of the the public litter bins on Market Place/Broadway. They are overflowing as seen in the attached picture. Please empty them (these bins are scheduled to be emptied daily).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light off, 16th August
item.description:
Steet light at the very top of Saint George’s square, on the side of belgrave road, bit working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St George's Square, Pimlico, London

item.title: Dumped Item, 16th August
item.description:
On Watling Street near to the junction with Halcot Avenue, Bexleyheath: There is part of a black car bumper on the grass verge which has been there for over three weeks - please could you remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 16th August
item.description:
At least 3 street lights, 2 at the corner between Lupus street and Saint George’s square, and one on Saint George’s square in the bit leading to belgrave road, are not working and haven’t worked for weeks. They are particularly dangerous as they leave a junction and crossing point completely dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, St George's Square, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess Litter/Debris, 16th August
item.description:
On Gravel Hill at the junction with Bourne Road, Bexleyheath: At the roundabout there is excess litter and other debris in the middle of the carriageway - specifically around the islands on the centre of the road. Please could you clean up the area with a sweeper lorry or a broom.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 16th August
item.description:
On Albion Road at the junction with Gravel Hill (roundabout), Bexleyheath: A lorry has misplaced a number of large stones which have fallen onto the carriageway. Please could you remove them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 16th August
item.description:
On Albion Road near to the junction with Royal Oak Road, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove dumped items of clothing from the pavement and grass verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Posters, 16th August
item.description:
On Herbert Road at the junction with Avenue Road, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove to illegal advertising posters from a green street cabinet on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, London
